Posted By: Jake1991 (4/25/2013 5:08:04 PM)

posts.post_content:
I like to play intro pack duels and the Gruul one is a blast, thanks in large part to this guy here. When he hits the board he just makes all sorts of trouble for your opponent, and thanks to cards like [Zhur-Taa Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Druid) you can even do damage while ramping into him. While he can end up hurting you when you cast spells I've yet to have that be an issue thanks to packing lots of bloodrush cards.  
  
The best part about that intro deck though was opening a second Ruric Thar in one of the boosters. ^^
posts.html:

Posted By: Wandy (5/27/2013 11:54:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
Ruric Thar is an incredibly versatile creature. I had him at the helm of my Gruul aggro EDH deck, but the has slowly evolved and incorporates elements of control and combo as well.  
  
- [Possibility Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Possibility Storm) is fantastic with him. Makes Ruric more difficult to deal with, especially in a singleton format like EDH.  
- BFFs with [Gratuitous Violence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gratuitous Violence) and [Grafted Exoskeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafted Exoskeleton)  
- Really nice synergy with [Nullstone Gargoyle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nullstone Gargoyle) and [Heartwood Storyteller](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartwood Storyteller).  
- [Basilisk Collar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Basilisk Collar) and [Loxodon Warhammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Warhammer) help mitigate his drawback.
posts.html:
Ruric Thar is an incredibly versatile creature. I had him at the helm of my Gruul aggro EDH deck, but the has slowly evolved and incorporates elements of control and combo as well.

- Possibility Storm is fantastic with him. Makes Ruric more difficult to deal with, especially in a singleton format like EDH.
- BFFs with Gratuitous Violence and Grafted Exoskeleton
- Really nice synergy with Nullstone Gargoyle and Heartwood Storyteller.
- Basilisk Collar and Loxodon Warhammer help mitigate his drawback.

posts.post_content:
I've been searching for a great commander for my creature focused deck and I can't believe it. Ruric Thar's been staring at me blankly this entire time and I missed it entirely over my obsession with [Aurelia the Warleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia the Warleader). A bit unfortunate I never did play that [Aurelia's fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia's fury) so he could punch some sense into me.  
  
It hurts a lot to have to cut her... But it hurts more to not play green. Rith is nice, but just... Ruric Thar feels more like the focus of my kind of deck. Anyway, let's get some footing.  
  
[Domri Rade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Domri Rade), [Garruk, Caller of Beasts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Caller of Beasts) and [Garruk's Horde](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Horde) give us a delicious start, allowing us to obtain card advantage. Some creature focused ramp, we can use [birds of paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=birds of paradise), [elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=221892) and [Zhur-Taa Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Druid). We could play around Ruric & Thar's hatred of magic by not casting with him in play, but that weak... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Domri Rade, Garruk, Caller of Beasts and Garruk's Horde give us a delicious start, allowing us to obtain card advantage.
